medium: Color lithograph; trial proof with crayon additions and pencil notations
provenance:
Henri M. Petiet, Paris (his sale; Piasa, Paris, June 7, 2007, lot 76); [C.G. Boerner, Paris and New York; sold to Dayton]; Ruth and Bruce Dayton, Wayzata, Minn.; given to MIA, 2008.

Note from Armin Kunz: Our Denis proof set comes  from Petiet, and we do not know where he acquired it. The Petiet collection is much older than the Josefowitz collection. We know that all the handwritten annotations must have been done by Denis and were intended for Clot, the printer. It is likely that the printer held onto these proofs and kept them (rather than giving them back to the artist).
But this is not certain, as there are no stamps or documents that prove this contention.
title: Sur le canapé d'argent pâle (On the Pale Silver Sofa), from "Amour"
